definition: to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
surname Xiu
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: You can adjust the stock width and height, and fix or randomize the colors.
sentences.chinese: 你能夠整修股票寬度和高度，和固定或者隨機化顏色。

sentences.english: NO04, The government did up the old train station last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年政府重新整修了老車站。

sentences.english: We will need to find an interior decorating company to redo the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須找一家室內裝潢公司來整修廚房。

sentences.english: My father spent a whole day mending the hedge.
sentences.chinese: 我父親花了一整天的時間整修樹籬。

sentences.english: The renovated amusement park has a brand-new image.
sentences.chinese: 整修後的遊樂場新姿奪目。

sentences.english: My company bought an old building, gave it a face-lift, and converted it to offices.
sentences.chinese: 我的公司購置了一幢舊房，整修後將它變成了辦公樓。

sentences.english: The liner has been refitted from stem to stern.
sentences.chinese: 那艘班輪已經全面整修。

sentences.english: The whole cabaret pass by 2003 repair behind Be renovating.
sentences.chinese: 整個酒店經過2003裝修後在無任何整修。

sentences.english: She’s been fixing it up, you know.
sentences.chinese: 她一直在整修那所房子，你們知道的。

sentences.english: It is time to renovate the nest.
We bought an old house and are doing it up.
sentences.chinese: 我們買了一所舊房子，現正在加以整修。

sentences.english: Most of that money will be used to refurbish a port that will be for India's use.
sentences.chinese: 這筆錢的大部分將被用來整修一個爲印度所用的港口。

sentences.english: This procedure is not clear. Do you refit or rebuild?
sentences.chinese: 這一程序不明確。你整修或重建？

sentences.english: In the summer holidays,they busied themselves keeping the lawn in order.
sentences.chinese: 暑假期間他們忙於整修草坪。

sentences.english: A new larger building was bought and renovated, which has been the museum's home ever since.
sentences.chinese: 他買下了一棟新建軒閣，整修一新，從此作爲館址。

sentences.english: I understand his store is going to be renovated next week.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他的店下個禮拜要整修。

to build/to construct
to extend (a building, an airport runway etc)
to reinforce (a structure)/to strengthen
overhaul
to repair (sth broken)/to restore (sth damaged)/to establish friendly relations with/(literary) to do meritorious deeds
to build
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to finish work/to complete a project
refurbishment/renovation
to repair/to fix/to prune/to trim/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
